page.title: 04The Barby Church
page.content: Barby Church is called St.Mary's. Rev.Scott is called the Rector in Barby. Barby Church is 750 years old. One of the well known names in Barby is Pittom. There is a line of graves with the Pittom name on in the Church yard. A lane is called Pittoms Lane and Mrs.Pittom runs the Village Hall. Inside the Church there are four pointed arches either side of the building. The Church has got five bells, an organ, a piano, an altar and a side-altar. On top of the Church there is a cockerel. The font is 8 sided and also has a wooden lid. There has recently been a new roof put on the Church and Â£20,000 was raised. The lectern was made out of cast iron and it was in the shape of an eagle. Outside the Church there is a memorial to the Great War.
